Line.Text: It’s 2048, and bookshelves are used for… books again? This is madness.
Historic recurrence is a ruthless thing indeed.
How can anyone still use this? You can’t even change the font size.
Is it the pleasant smell of paper? The aesthetic beauty of a finely printed cover? The tactile feeling and the soothing sound of turning pages? Tell me your secret, books.
Admit it: no juicy text file in the world beats holding one of these beauties in your hands.
These tree-killing, space-consuming, dust-gathering constructs just refuse to die.
Should I assume that Sam and I were wrong, and educated people were using bookshelves for books all along? No, the implications are too much to bear.
